bibl.note: This document is a letter dated October 17, 1848 from John M. Bass to the governor of Tennessee, Neill S. Brown. The subject of the brief letter is an erection of a monument for the state's late governor William Carroll.

div.p: At the request of majr major Heiman I state with pleasure that from the progress made by him in the erection of the monument over the remains of the late gov governor Carroll under the contract with the state the sum of $1000 or even more may be advanced to him with perfect safety

closer.add: I have the honor to be with great respect yr obt svt your obedient servant

His Exclly Excellency
N Neill .S Brown Nashville
